About the role

At BOQ Group, we’re building a simpler, more resilient bank, and strong risk capability is at the heart of that transformation. As a Senior Analyst in Line 1 Risk, you’ll play an important role in helping our teams embed proactive, thoughtful and practical risk management every day. This role is all about empowering the business to make confident decisions that balance opportunity with strong, safe outcomes for our customers and the Group.

You’ll work closely with Business Unit leaders and partner with Group functions to ensure our risk practices align with BOQ Group’s Risk Management Strategy and standards. Your work will help uplift controls, strengthen our risk culture and ensure we’re meeting regulatory expectations. From providing day‑to‑day risk advice to supporting change assessments, designing and enhancing controls, analysing key trends, or assisting with governance and reporting, you’ll be a trusted voice that helps the organisation understand risk and respond to it effectively.

This role is hands‑on and collaborative, and you’ll contribute to activities that support the Group’s control environment, including risk in change assessments, management of issues and events, developing and updating risk profiles, and supporting the delivery of BOQ Group’s remedial actions.

You’ll also play a part in building capability across the business by sharing knowledge, offering guidance and supporting teams to lift their confidence in core risk practices.

About you

You’re someone who enjoys working in a dynamic environment where risk management genuinely shapes the way we operate. You bring curiosity, strong analytical thinking and a commitment to enabling better outcomes for our customers and our people.

You’re comfortable engaging across different teams, offering clear and pragmatic advice, and supporting stakeholders to understand risks, obligations and controls in a way that feels accessible and constructive.

Your background includes experience in risk management within financial services or a related environment, and you understand how to navigate regulatory expectations and non‑financial risk disciplines. You communicate clearly, think logically and pay close attention to detail. You enjoy unpacking complex issues, exploring root causes and designing solutions that strengthen control effectiveness. You also value collaboration and take pride in contributing to a positive team culture where continuous improvement is part of how you work.

If you’re looking for a role where you can influence meaningful change, deepen your expertise and help shape the future of risk at BOQ Group, this is an opportunity to make a real impact.

About us

BOQ Group is a truly unique group of challenger brands with a purpose – to provide a genuine alternative to Australian financial services for customers and employees.

Our family of brands (Bank of Queensland (BOQ), ME Bank, Virgin Money Australia, BOQ Specialist), each come with their own defined customer audience and brand personality, but share one goal – to build social capital through banking. That’s creating trust with customers, exploring staff potential and believing that tiny gestures and big ideas can change the world for communities.

BOQ Group’s inclusive vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.

Since 2021, BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).

In 2023, we successfully implemented an innovative Reconciliation Plan, driving positive change and promoting inclusivity across BOQ Group.

Our perks

At BOQ Group, we are passionate about creating an exceptional work environment that nurtures both your professional and personal growth.

Our comprehensive benefits package is designed to enhance your well-being, provide financial security, and foster a sense of community and inclusion. Here are just some of the fantastic perks you can enjoy as part of our team:

Flexible working arrangement - Balance your work and personal life with ease.

Discounted financial products - Enjoy exclusive rates on our financial services across the Group.

Salary sacrificing options - Maximise your take-home pay with our salary packaging options.

Paid parental leave with no minimum requirements - Spend quality time with your new family member without any worries.

Purchase additional annual leave - Need more time off? You can buy extra leave days.

Discounted private health insurance plan - Take care of your health with our special rates.

Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - Access confidential support for personal and professional challenges for you and your family

Access to employee network groups - Connect with peers through our First Nations Reconciliation, LGBTQIA+, Multicultural, Gender, Early Careers, and accessibility groups.

Pride in Diversity membership - We are proud members of Pride in Diversity and actively participate in the Australian Workplace Equality Index.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and supported. Join us and be part of a company that truly cares about its people and community!

How to apply

To apply for this role, follow the links.

BOQ Group is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.

We celebrate, value and include people of all backgrounds, gender and expressions, sexualities, cultures, bodies and abilities. When you apply, you are welcome to tell us the pronouns you use and please let us know any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

If you are successful for a role with BOQ Group, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.

About Us

When people talk about the Flying Doctor, thoughts generally turn to red-bellied planes undertaking rescue missions in the Outback. However, the current Victorian story is one that reﬂects today's challenges for people living in remote and rural communities across the state. While we do still transport people by air and by road, this work is complemented by a range of primary health services that address the most common issues people living in country Victoria face when accessing health care.

The Head of Data, Insights & Supporter Experience plays a pivotal role in shaping Fundraising, Philanthropy and Corporate Partnerships strategy at RFDS Victoria. The role oversees data and insights, digital systems, and supporter experience to drive a cohesive, future‑focused strategy. By strengthening data governance, modernising technology, and elevating supporter experience, this position enables growth and enhances fundraising and partnership performance. Acting as a unifying force across people, platforms and processes, the role ensures that RFDS Victoria has the intelligence and infrastructure to deliver its ambitious agenda as we build towards our centenary in 2028.

Developing and delivering a transformational Data, Insights & Digital strategy that drives innovation and organisational growth.
Acting as the authority on fundraising and philanthropy data, advising leaders on risks, opportunities, and trends.
Leading data governance frameworks to ensure ownership, compliance, and strong privacy standards.
Providing actionable insights through analytics and reporting to improve performance across all portfolios.
Embedding relationship‑management and moves‑management frameworks to support strategic donor and partner stewardship.
Overseeing and optimising the digital and supporter engagement ecosystem to deliver seamless, high‑quality donor experiences.
Partnering with the Transformation Directorate on integration, automation, AI, and digital uplift initiatives.
Driving the integration, optimisation, and future‑proofing of the Raiser's Edge CRM and related platforms.
Reducing system fragmentation and improving organisational capability through streamlined processes and tools.
Aligning people, budgets, and technology to organisational priorities while fostering a proactive, high‑performance culture.
Collaborating across Fundraising, Partnerships, Data & Insights, and Transformation teams to deliver integrated, data‑driven solutions.

Essential

Strong strategic planning capability with experience delivering organisation‑wide data, digital, or insights strategies.
Demonstrated experience leading data, insights, digital, or supporter/customer experience functions with measurable impact.
Expertise in CRM and data management systems, ideally Raiser's Edge and RENXT.
Proven ability to design and implement data governance frameworks and lead system integration projects.
Skills in SQL, Excel, Tableau (or similar), with the ability to conduct analysis and build dashboards.
Strong change‑management capability, with experience uplifting data literacy and driving cultural and system adoption.
Excellent resource management skills, including managing people, budgets, and technology.

Desirable

Tertiary qualifications in Information Systems, Business, Digital, or related fields
Experience in fundraising or the not‑for‑profit sector

About the role

The Workday HR Systems Analyst plays a crucial role in executing configuration, managing operational health, and enabling automation across Canva’s core Workday modules - Core HCM, Advanced Compensation, Employee Voice (Engagement), and Performance Management.

This role sits at the heart of Canva’s tiered People Technology operating model:

Tier 1 (People Ops) handles frontline support and basic configuration.

Tier 2 (People Tech / You) delivers safe, business-led configuration of medium-complexity changes, leads testing, and partners with IT.

Tier 3 (IT / Technical System Owners) manages complex integrations, custom development, platform architecture, and compliance.

As a Tier 2 operator, you’ll configure and test safe changes within Workday, triage and troubleshoot issues, and partner with the People Ops team and IT to keep our platform stable and continuously improving. You’ll also lead the review, redesign, and optimisation of end-to-end workflows in Workday to reduce friction, remove unnecessary steps, and align with Canva’s evolving ways of working.

What you’d be doing in this role

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

Keeping Workday running smoothly: Configure and maintain Workday business processes, condition rules, security groups, time off rules, and org structure, and module-specific features within Core HCM, Advanced Compensation, Employee Voice (Engagement), and Performance.  Own user role assignments and audit access controls in partnership with IT. Plan, design, and execute end-to-end testing cycles for Workday changes, including unit testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT). Develop and maintain reusable test scripts and scenarios to ensure consistency across releases. Partner with People Ops and IT to coordinate integration testing, UAT, gather feedback, and resolve defects before deployment.
Automate and elevate processes: Identify manual or repetitive HR workflows and build automations using low-code tools like Workato to redesigning core business processes (e.g., onboarding, job changes, offboarding, approvals) to be more user-friendly, compliant, and efficient.
Be the first responder: Act as the Tier 2 contact for Workday-related issues raised by People Ops or escalated from Tier 1. Conduct root cause analysis and document known issues and fixes. Escalate complex technical or infrastructure issues to IT (Tier 3) when needed.
Maintain clean, compliant data and deliver actionable insights: Execute and validate bulk data changes (e.g., manager changes, org restructures, location updates). Ensure changes for compensation cycles, performance processes, or other events are accurately reflected in Workday and free from errors. Partner with People Ops to prevent downstream data quality issues and maintain compliance with policies and regulations. Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytics in Workday to provide actionable insights for stakeholders.
Liaise with vendors and partners: Raise and track support tickets with Workday or third-party vendors. Work closely with IT to support Workday platform upgrades and regression testing. Maintain documentation for configuration history, data mapping, and change impact assessments.
Enable self-service and readiness: Create engaging, easy-to-follow guides, knowledge articles, videos, or in-system prompts for Canva users and People Ops teams. Support testing and change communications for Workday feature releases.
Improve over time: Proactively map current-state workflows, identify pain points, and propose future-state designs that improve efficiency, compliance, and user experience. Participate in roadmap planning with Product Owners to prioritise changes that improve scale, accuracy, and usability. Contribute to building AI- and automation-enabled system capabilities that support operational excellence.

You're probably a match if you

Workday know-how: Comfortable navigating Workday modules. Core HCM and Advanced Compensation essential. Bonus for other modules such as Employee Voice (Engagement), and Performance Management , BP frameworks, supervisory orgs, and access roles.

Workflow design skills: Ability to assess, redesign, and implement business processes that enhance system usability and operational efficiency.

Problem-solving mindset: You’re comfortable triaging and resolving system issues and understand how to apply safe-change practices.

Automation confidence: You’ve worked with low-code tools like Workato (or similar) and can build simple to moderately complex flows.

Data fluency: Confident working with large datasets, validating accuracy, and ensuring changes don’t break downstream reporting.

Cross-functional communicator: Able to explain configuration choices to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

AI curious: Interested in experimenting with smart tools and AI agents that can augment user experience or reduce human workload.

Bias for action: You move things forward, solve problems, and take ownership of your space in the system landscape.
